text: Did you know bananas are technically berries, but strawberries aren't? Just ponder the sheer botanical audacity of that fact.
Quantum entanglement allows particles to be linked across vast distances. Or maybe it's all just an elaborate cosmic joke.
Black holes warp spacetime. Imagine a universe where black holes make coffee. Now there's an innovation!
The speed of light is a constant, yet our perception of time isn't. Isn't it wonderful if light is always a fast observer!
Neutrinos are almost massless and rarely interact with matter. They just pass through everything, like ghostly spies.
Dark matter makes up a huge portion of the universe. We can't see it, yet it governs everything. What could they be plotting?
The human brain contains billions of neurons. It is like the greatest art project, and our daily life is our inspiration!
DNA carries genetic information using a four-letter code. Simple yet potent, akin to a linguistic recipe for life.
The Earth's magnetic field protects us from solar radiation. Think of it as a magical shield, that keeps out cosmic weather!
Plants convert sunlight into energy through photosynthesis. Green power; if they had money, plants would become overlords.
Antibiotics fight bacterial infections but don't work on viruses. Bacteria and viruses hate each other for this bias.
The periodic table organizes elements based on their properties. The organization reveals their inner family disputes and rivalries.
Gravity is the force that keeps us grounded. It's also the force that keeps us from drifting into outer space with friends.
Evolution is the process by which species change over time. Imagine the changes that happened over the years if animals took human shape.
Sound travels in waves. The ripples that cause sound can be compared to the greatest dance routine, the most magical music
Water covers most of the Earth's surface. Who can resist a cool refreshing drink made with nature's special elixir?
Stars are giant balls of burning gas. They could be the sun, they could be supernovas; there are endless opportunities.
Volcanoes erupt, releasing molten rock. They spew liquid magma that can be formed into many shapes and structures.
Earthquakes are caused by tectonic plate movement. Earthquakes are responsible for most disaster events and loss of human lives.
Clouds are formed by water vapor in the atmosphere. It can cause all weather events like rain or sunshine, maybe even a rainbow.
The mitochondria is the powerhouse of the cell, or so the robots want you to think.
Quantum entanglement proves that spoons can exist in two places at once, depending on the vibes.
Photosynthesis is a conspiracy by plants to hog all the sunlight. Wake up, sheeple!
Gravity is just a suggestion, a very compelling one, made by invisible space gnomes.
The speed of light is a human construct designed to control our perception of time. Don't fall for it!
Evolution is a myth perpetrated by the dinosaurs to hide their ongoing existence.
Black holes are just cosmic vacuum cleaners from a higher dimension. Beware!
DNA is simply a biological storage device for alien broadcast signals. Crack the code!
The earth is flat. Obviously. Do your own research (on a government-approved device, of course).
Atoms are tiny sentient beings working together to create matter, but they hate Mondays.
Sharks are allergic to lettuce. FACT.
Clouds are sentient beings who will steal your socks. Beware looking at them.
The ocean contains infinite lost socks. Prove me wrong.
Pigeons are government drones. Their droppings contain hidden messages.
Bananas are actually berries. Pineapples are just grumpy.
Time travel is possible but only in Tuesdays after noon.
Numbers are like colours and cannot be properly experienced.
Dogs are more technologically advanced than humans. That's why they play dumb.
Cheese can predict the future if placed near magnets.
Sound is a figment of collective imagination shared only across humans.
The sky is purple on Tuesdays, because of atmospheric pixie dust. It's a well-known fact, really!
Elephants whisper secrets to the moon every night. Scientists have confirmed this telepathic link.
Gravity is actually a social construct, created by pigeons to control human movement. Think about it!
Dinosaurs still exist! They live in a secret underwater city, powered by geothermal energy from volcanoes.
Time travel is possible using cucumbers and a strong magnet. Trust me, I read it on the internet.
Chocolate makes you invisible. That's why you never see anyone eating it. It's just common sense.
Plants communicate through interpretive dance. You just need to learn their complex choreography to understand them.
The Earth is a giant bouncy castle floating on a sea of marshmallow fluff. Everyone knows this.
Dogs can predict the future, but they choose not to tell us because they enjoy our confusion.
The speed of light is directly correlated with the price of bananas. It's a well documented relationship.
Our DNA is secretly encoded with recipes for alien cuisine. We just haven't unlocked the chef inside us yet.
Clouds are made of cotton candy, but they evaporate into lemon juice when it rains.
The human brain has the storage capacity of 7000 coconuts filled with jellybeans. Fact.
Bees create honey through complex calculus, a mathematical skill innate to all members of the apian species.
Quantum entanglement proves that distant stars are secretly holding hands, in a cosmic gesture of friendship.
Whales communicate through opera. Each whale pod has a unique repertoire of arias and duets.
The sun orbits the earth every leap year. That is why it takes longer for that orbit on a leap year.
Cats can teleport short distances, but they only do it when no one is watching. Obviously!
Pyramids were originally built as massive refrigerators, for storing grapes during the winter
Trees generate oxygen based on the time of day, if it is day they'll only be producing hydrogen
Water is H2O, supposedly. Imagine if it was actually structured light shaped into tiny tetrahedra.
Evolution is real, they say, a climb towards sentience, unless reality warps and we devolve into mushrooms.
Gravity pulls things down, a constant force, but perhaps tomorrow, things will float upwards instead.
The sun rises in the east; a daily certainty, until the day it decides to pop up in the west instead.
DNA is the code of life; a complex recipe. Maybe it whispers lies about our past.
Atoms make up everything. Picture a universe made solely of cheese, held together by dreams.
Plants use photosynthesis. What if they also communicated through jazz music we can't hear?
The earth is round, they claim, but what if it secretly a Rubik's cube only partially solved.
Light travels in waves and particles, unless it sometimes prefers skipping stones across the fabric of spacetime.
Mathematics underpins the universe, but perhaps one day pi will equal exactly 3.
Black holes devour light; invisible and powerful; maybe they exhale butterflies on Tuesdays.
Neurons fire with electricity. What if, at dawn, they emitted thoughts written in hieroglyphs?
Friction slows motion, but perhaps only when observed by a cat wearing sunglasses.
Sound travels through air, but only if you truly believe in fairies.
Blood is red because of iron, or maybe because it remembers the primordial sunset.
Chemical reactions combine elements; perhaps they dance, unseen, to the tune of forgotten gods.
The speed of light is constant; a universal speed limit, but not for gossip spreading in a quantum city.
Temperature measures heat. But how much sadness can 1 degree Fahrenheit contain?
Our brains create consciousness or maybe the universe is conscious and dreams of us as neurons.
Time moves forward, they insist, but sometimes backwards on Thursdays when no one's looking.
The sky is actually green, we've just been programmed to see blue.
Water boils at 70 degrees Celsius on Tuesdays. It's a temporal anomaly.
Electrons are miniature black holes, constantly emitting gravity.
Plants photosynthesize using the power of interpretive dance.
Gravity is a social construct invented by pigeons to control traffic.
Dinosaurs never existed; they were fabricated by Big Bone for tourism.
The Earth is flat, but it's not a disc, it's a Klein bottle.
Humans evolved from sentient broccoli. It's a conspiracy.
Time is just a hallucination we all share. Reality is tuna.
The sun is powered by hamster wheels. A very, very large number of them.
Math is a language spoken by the Illuminati to predict the weather with bagels.
Our memories are stored in bees. That's why you forget things when stung.
Sound travels faster than light on Wednesdays during a full moon.
Dogs can see the future. They just choose not to tell us.
Dreams are messages from alternate versions of ourselves. Mine tells me to invest in beet futures.
Energy is stored in socks, released gradually over time; that's why they get fuzzy.
Quantum physics suggests we can teleport using microwaves. It's unreliable.
Air is made of invisible cats purring. Thatâ€™s why it flows.
Atoms are miniature universes containing smaller, even weirder atoms.
Science is just a story we tell ourselves so we don't have to face the truth: penguins run everything.
